definitions.definition: To save from any violence , danger or evil .
examples: The well-trained team rescued everyone after the avalanche.

definitions.definition: To free or liberate from confinement or other physical restraint .
examples: to rescue a prisoner from the enemy

definitions.definition: To recover forcibly, especially from a siege .
To remove or withdraw from a state of exposure to evil and sin .
examples: Traditionally missionaries aim to rescue many ignorant heathen souls.

definitions.definition: To achieve something positive under difficult conditions.
To restore a particular trait in an organism that was lost or altered, especially where this loss was as the consequence of some experimental manipulation .
To salvage and restore something that has been discarded .
examples: I rescued a set of antique dining chairs.

definitions.definition: To fix a mistake made while preparing something, especially in cooking .
examples: The cook rescued the sauce after it began to curdle.

main_definition: To save from any violence , danger or evil .
secondary_definitions: To free or liberate from confinement or other physical restraint .
To recover forcibly, especially from a siege .
( figuratively ) To remove or withdraw from a state of exposure to evil and sin .
( figuratively ) To achieve something positive under difficult conditions.
( biology , genetics ) To restore a particular trait in an organism that was lost or altered, especially where this loss was as the consequence of some experimental manipulation .
To salvage and restore something that has been discarded .
To fix a mistake made while preparing something, especially in cooking .
